title: >>> HEATWAVE '07
body_text:
From the onslaughts of
2005 vs. 2007
and
Sister vs. Sister
comes the
HeatWave '07
! Brace yourself for the absolute hottest matches and kick-ass, in-your-face action as only the warriors of Wall High School can deliver. Prepare to sweat, prepare to bleed, all in the midst of combat.
Think you're ready to face the heat?
We'll just have to wait and see.
We're kicking things off with the first of three straight main events, all on
The Road to 90
...
EDWARDS vs. BUTLER
Crafty dodgers, impact throwers, fearless combatants, and hell,
R.A.T.S.
teammates too! But perhaps the one thing that makes these iron men so distinct can be described in one word:
undefeated
. Mix all of these ingredients and you've got a recipe for disaster.
Mike EDWARDS
The mammouth challenge of the iconic Kevin Megill was one obstacle damn near impossible to overcome. It was Megill who chopped down the giants and slaughtered the weak establishing a flawless 3 and 0 record for himself. This was the kind of monster Mike Edwards was dealt with entering his debut captains showdown. But there is a reason he's an award-winning, respected veteran of today.
Those that attended the 80th dodgeball extravaganza will likely never forget the happenings and eventual outcome of the heated match-up. In what some may view as an upset simply based on Edwards's inexperience as team general, it was "The Crazy One" who emerged with his hand high in the air, signaling his defeat of the one and only powerhouse Kevin Megill. It was a stunning start to a career just taking off.
Mike BUTLER
One man's tryout match and the rebirth of the
Rimshot Contest
added fuel to April 2007's DODGEBALL 82.
In the anticipated 6th
Rimshot Contest
, the fighting titan Sara DeCuir emerged as the sole survivor, embarking on the so-called "Butler Campaign". Sara's past experience and knowledge as team general certainly gave her the edge heading into this big time showdown. But Butler came to win and little would he have expected the damage left on the court.
At the end of the night, seven of the total eight games were deservingly awarded to the debuting captain Mike "M Bizzle" Butler, a fine start to quite possibly one of the greatest captains career of all-time.
UNDEFEATED vs. UNDEFEATED
HeatWave '07
begins with a bang as two unmarked records of 1 and 0 clash on
The Road to 90
. The next level of success awaits the presence of both men. But only one will grab the brass ring.
